main event: An orange colored object, triangular in shape, was sighted about 50 to 60 degrees above the horizon. It glowed and had a blue-green tinge, remained stationary to the northwest, and disappeared within 20 seconds.
interesting points: The angular velocity indicates the object was at a considerable distance.
The object was viewed through 20% cloud cover, so details were not distinct for an accurate estimation.
Another sighting described the object as round or ovate, the size of a volleyball at arm's length, and red or orange-red in color.
The object was described as egg-shaped with a point down and a bright spot near the base, and as triangular when viewed through a 30-power telescope.
Neither a hot air balloon with a fire nor the re-entry and burning-up of a Soviet moon shot seemed to satisfactorily explain the sightings, and there was no physical evidence.
sighted object: orange triangular object, round or ovate object
